unit_learning_outcomes.description: Design and conduct a project-based activity in an intercultural context within and outside the university environment.
Collate, analyse and evaluate data collected during intercultural encounters.
Identify ways in which society and culture interact and locally manifest in the Australian context.
Demonstrate proficiency in self-organisation and effective project management.
Demonstrate extensive library and information retrieval skills relevant to the nominated project.
Communicate a targeted aspect of language specific cultural life to peers, teachers and the public using written, oral and/or digital media in a nuanced and sophisticated manner.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Preparation for consultation with project supervisor

assessments.description: Plan that details scope, activities and timeline of the project, submitted electronically via Turnitin.
Oral presentation using digital media, on campus or performed online via Zoom.
Report of findings and conclusions, submitted electronically via Turnitin.

Session 1, Intensive attendance, North Ryde

academic_org.value: Department of Media, Communications, Creative Arts, Language and Literature

data.description: Can various experiences, practices and perspectives of a culture tell us something unique about that culture? This project-based unit seeks to promote a nuanced and sophisticated understanding of, and engagement with, lived experiences in the broad context of the intersection of language, culture and society. It focuses on helping students enhance their appreciation of aspects of intercultural life and practices as well as sites of meaning in a culturally and linguistically specific environment. Through a semi-guided project, students will be encouraged to explore one aspect of intercultural life in the Australian context by collecting and analysing community-relevant factual data.
data.title: Intercultural Language Project 3
